explanation: Banned in Hawaii. Includes oxybenzone and octinoxate, went into effect on January 1, 2021
Not reef safe: Contains chemicals proposed to be banned in Hawaii like octocrylene, avobenzone, benzophenone, octisalate, homosalate, or ethylhexyl salicylate.
Mineral: Mineral sunscreen is better than chemicals, but effects of titanium dioxide are unknown. May contain nano-particles. Zinc oxide as active ingredient not labeled as non-nano.
Reef safe: Only active ingredient is non-nano zinc oxide.
